column3:
Within the RDP are not supported activities related to the production of tobacco. In the texts of Program for the period 2007-2013 has been indicated that support for tobacco producers will be fully focused on diversifying their holdings. Support for tobacco producers is aimed at the diversification of the activities of farmers by non-agricultural activities or different types of agricultural activities aimed at diversification of tobacco production within the tools of RDP.
The producers that suspend activities related to the production of tobacco and start to deal with growing cows (in milk or meat direction) sheep and goats or with production of fruits and vegetables in 2014 can take advantage of the support that is provided by the following schemes for specific support:
Scheme to improve the quality of fruits and vegetables produced in Bulgaria
This scheme for specific support is directed to the traditional production of fruits and vegetables - tomatoes cucumbers peppers apples cherries peaches and nectarines and apricots. The scheme to improve the quality of fruits and vegetables is applied for the first time in Bulgaria by a campaign for direct payments in 2012. In order to receive assistance producers must grow at least 4 acres vegetables or 5 acres of fruits and areas have to meet the requirements for good agricultural condition. The aim of the scheme is to provide additional incentives to produce quality fruits and vegetables. Production is carried out in accordance with quality indicators that are subject to constant monitoring by inspectors from the Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety. Subject to any requirements under the scheme producers receive a certificate of quality as certification is free for manufacturers. By an Order of the Minister of Agriculture and Food ? RD 09-311/26.03.2012 are approved product specifications under the scheme to improve the quality of fruits and vegetables produced in Bulgaria. Orders and other information on the scheme are available at: www.mzh.government.bg heading CAP / Direct payments / Scheme to improve the quality of fruits and vegetables.
The budget for the scheme for 2014 is 37 million lev.
Scheme to maintain the production of cow milk in economically vulnerable farms
Eligible for assistance under the scheme are producers of cow milk having individual milk quota and managing a farm that meets the following requirements: 
1. is registered in the Register of farms for production of cow milk;
2 . there are raised from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) of dairy cows registered in the System for animal identification and registration of animal holdings in Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety.
Assistance under the scheme shall be paid when dairy farmers continue to grow stated dairy cows at least 100 days from the day following the last day for the submission of applications for support and have individual milk quota.
Scheme to maintain the cow milk production in disadvantaged areas
Eligible for assistance under the scheme are producers of cow milk having individual milk quota and managing a farm that meets the following requirements:
1. is registered in the Register of farms for production of cow milk;
2. is located within the territorial scope of disadvantaged areas under the Ordinance setting out the criteria for disadvantaged areas and their territorial scope approved by Decree of the Council of Ministers ? 30 of 2008 (SG ? 20 of 2008);
3. It raises 10 or more dairy cows registered in the System of animal identification and registration of holdings in Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety.
Assistance under the scheme shall be paid when dairy farmers continue to grow stated dairy cows at least 100 days from the day following the last day for the submission of applications for support and have individual milk quota.
Scheme to maintain the production of cow milk in nitrate vulnerable zones
Eligible for assistance under the scheme are producers of cow milk having individual milk quota and managing a farm that meets the following requirements:
1. is registered in the Register of farms for production of cow milk;
2. Located in municipalities in nitrate vulnerable zones. They are defined in Annex ? 3 (List of municipalities in nitrate vulnerable zones) and Annex ? 4 (List of municipalities in previous vulnerable zones for which transitional assistance will be applied) of Ordinance ? 2 of 21 February 2011 for special requirements for participation in approved schemes for national surcharge and specific support.
3. It raises 50 or more dairy cows registered in the System of animal identification and registration of holdings.
Assistance under the scheme shall be paid when dairy farmers continue to grow stated dairy cows at least 100 days from the day following the last day for the submission of applications for support and have individual milk quota.
Scheme for specific support for sucker cows (scheme coupled)
Eligible for assistance under the scheme for specific support for sucker cows is a farmer that:
1. has no individual milk quota;
2. raises in his farm 5 or more cows and/or heifers under the scheme for sucker cows registered in System of animal identification and registration of holdings in Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety.
Assistance under the scheme for sucker cows shall be paid when after submission of the application to support the farmer continues to raise the requested cows and/or heifers at least 100 days from the day following the last day for the submission of applications for support and has no individual milk quota. Support under the sucker cow scheme is determined based on the number of cows and heifers requested for support actually raised on the farm.
Scheme for cultivation of ewes and goats in economically vulnerable communities in Southern Bulgaria
This is a scheme that was developed and is specifically aimed at producers in economically vulnerable tobacco-producing communities in South Bulgaria.
Entitled to support under the scheme for cultivation of ewes and goats in economically vulnerable communities in Southern Bulgaria have farmers who:
1. manage farms located within the territorial scope of economically vulnerable communities in Southern Bulgaria included in Annex ? 2 to Ordinance ? 2 of 21 February 2011 for the special requirements for participation in approved schemes for national surcharge and specific support;
2. raise in farms under item 1:
a) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) ewes or
b) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) goats or
c) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) ewes and goats registered in the System of animal identification and registration of holdings in Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety.
3. continue to grow stated ewes and/or goats at least 100 days from the day following the last day for submission of applications for support.
Scheme for cultivation of ewes and goats in less-favoured areas
Eligible for assistance under the scheme are farmers who :
1. manage farms located in less-favoured areas according to the Ordinance setting out the criteria for less-favoured areas and their territorial scope;
2. raise in farms under item 1:
a) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) ewes or
b) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) goats or
c) from 10 (inclusive) to 49 (inclusive) ewes and goats registered in the System of animal identification and registration of holdings in Bulgarian Agency for Food Safety.
3. continue to grow stated ewes and / or goats at least 100 days from the day following the last day for submission of applications for support.
The total amount of schemes for specific support for 2014 for Bulgaria is 103.5 million lev.

column4:
En cuanto a medidas de reconversión/diversificación a otros sectores cabe recordar que:
El Fondo Comunitario del Tabaco FCT creado en 1992 y operativo hasta 2010 ha permitido financiar estudios sobre las posibilidades de reconversión de los productores de tabaco crudo a otros cultivos o actividades (desde 1998) y acciones específicas de reconversión hacia otros cultivos o actividades económicas creadoras de empleo (desde 2002). 
En base al FCT se han hecho estudios sobre distintas alternativas: productos hortofrutícolas agricultura ecológica biocarburantes y se han llevado a cabo proyectos de: cultivo de plantas aromáticas tomate brócoli agroenergéticos etc.
Dichos estudios y experiencias concluyen que si bien la respuesta agronómica es satisfactoria en las zonas donde se localiza la alternativa al cultivo del tabaco es económicamente difícil pues pasa por muchas diferentes soluciones y no existe una gran y única alternativa.
Existing policies only encourage crop diversification.

As per Decision of Council of Ministers No. 2008/14265 tobacco growers in 9 cities of Turkey who renounced from tobacco production have prefered to grow alternative products. Referring to Tobacco Production and Purchase-Sale Agreement with Monopoly Administration in 2008 these growers shall be annually provided with one-off subsidy for the years 2009 2010 and 2011. 
Relevant legislation can be found at the following link: http://www.tugem.gov.tr/document/alternatif_urun_destegi.html
